system.biography:
TitleFFF 804d Gargu-Araki Warrior
Birthday16 Larane 707
AppearanceAge 12, height 3’2”, light frame (size 2), weight 72 lb, pallid appearance, yellowish brown hair, brown eyes.
Medical/Psyche
Size0
ArmorChainmail byrnie, plate greaves, and cloth tunic. Mang.
Other EquipmentLeather belt and belt pouch holding various dried and fresh herbs and gargun sausage.
Valuables39d worth of coins. 360 pence worth of herbs.
Notes

Biography

As a lesser member of a Gargu-khanu colony, Bran was tasked with the job of caring for newly hatched Khanu. This was no small feat given the Khanu predilection for devouring the occasional young and their aggressiveness toward members of “lesser” species.

One day, Bran noted a youth that hatched mute, a sure sign (to orc eyes) of substandard intellect and with a likely fate of being killed and eaten by a Khanu adult. This youth readily did what Bran commanded so Bran named him Pinka (a Gargu-araki word for “slave”). As long as Bran ensured that the youth did not get underfoot, the Khanu were amused enough to spare Pinka. Bran had to supplement Pinka’s diet with herbs and fungi. Although such a diet is abhorrent to orcs of sound mind, simple Pinka didn’t care. To Bran’s amazement, Pinka thrived on the diet and achieved tremendous physical size and strength that offset his stupidity. Bran also found that Pinka’s easily agitated mind was calmed and pliable after imbibing certain concoctions derived from herbs and roots.

Bran uses his intellect to guide Pinka and provide for both their needs. Pinka bullies and intimidates the other orcs and enforces Bran’s wishes. They are rarely separated from each other because Bran fears that other gargun will try to assassinate Pinka and Pinka grows agitated if Bran isn’t close by.

As long as Bran gives the Khanu of the colony a wide berth, he is free to bully the other slaves and take what he wants. No orc is willing to harm Bran, having seen Pinka’s ability to slaughter and devour those who threaten his Araki friend. Bran knows he plays a dangerous game. A king may grow jealous enough to murder the two regardless of Pinka’s phenomenal prowess.

HOOKS

Master Blaster. The PCs are captured by gargun and expect a horrid fate. To their surprise, the king offers them their lives in exchange for taking care of a pair of problematic orcs in his hive.

Needs the Right Kick. The potion Bran regularly feeds Pinka to keep him docile is losing its potency. He needs to make a fresh brew. The PCs discover him outside the colony gathering herbs. To the PCs’ surprise, the Araki offers to lead the PCs to a valuable patch of herbs in exchange for dealing with a wild beast that keeps him from a vital ingredient.

This Should Be Easy. The PCs are assaulting a gargun hive. They corner a little Araki and are ready to lay him low when a large shadowy figure with a really big axe rises up behind them.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
